dataIdInfo.idAbs: This Python tool exports selected bookmarks in a MXD document to PNG format.

tool.name: ExportBookmarks

param.name: useCurrentFile
param.dialogReference:
Checked - Export bookmarks in the currently opened document. This is the DEFAULT.

Unchecked - Select another document to export from.
param.pythonReference: A boolean to specify whether the tool should run on the currently opened map document. Defaults to True.

param.name: mxdFile
param.pythonReference: A DEFile specifying the map document to export from.

param.name: outLocation
param.dialogReference: The output directory where exported files will be saved.
param.pythonReference: A DEFolder specifying output directory where exported files will be saved.

param.name: exportList
param.dialogReference: The bookmarks available in the selected map document.
param.pythonReference: A GPString list of the bookmarks available in the selected document.

param.name: exportLayout
param.dialogReference:
Specifies whether the exported image should use the layout defined in the map document.

Checked - Export using layout.

Unchecked - Export the data frame only. Layout settings will be ignored. This is the DEFAULT setting.
param.pythonReference: A boolean to specify whether the output file should contain layout elements e.g. titles, scales, legends. Defaults to False.

param.name: outputW
param.dialogReference:
Output image width in inches.

This setting only applies when Export Layout is unchecked.
param.pythonReference: A GPDouble specifying output image width in inches. This setting only applies when Export Layout is True.

param.name: outputH
param.dialogReference:
Output image height in inches.

This setting only applies when Export Layout is unchecked.
param.pythonReference: A GPDouble specifying output image height in inches. This setting only applies when Export Layout is True.

tool.summary: This Python tool exports selected bookmarks in a MXD document to PNG format.
tool.usage: Use this tool to export one or more bookmarks in a map document to PNG format. You may specify output image height and width in inches, or use the document layout default.
